title: Why children must emit eight times less CO2 than their grandparents

multiplechoice.text: The Paris Agreement had the goal of limiting global warming to below __°C, and ideally __°C.
What is the approximate value of global emissions of CO2 per person per year?
The lifetime budget of someone born today is equal to how many years of current per capita emissions for 2°C of warming?
The lifetime budget of someone born today is equal to how many years of current per capita emissions for 1.5°C of warming?
For someone born in 2000 the lifetime allowance given 2°C of warming is what?
For someone born in 2017 the lifetime allowance given 1.5°C of warming is 86 tonnes, or how __ economy flights NY to Mumbai?

unranked.text: Given a warming of 1.5°C, someone born in the US today can emit approximately one __ of the lifetime emissions of someone born in 1950.
For warming to be kept below 2°C emissions would have to fall ~50% by which year?
For warming to be kept below 1.5°C emissions would have to fall ~50% by which year?
What is the catch-all term for ways in which carbon is removed from the atmosphere? (hint: two words)
Other than differences between countries, what further complicates the division of emissions? (hint: two words)
The average Indian had emissions of 1.9 tonnes of CO2 in 2017. What was the average in the US?
For simplicity, the article uses a constant expected lifespan of how many years?
What is the value of sustainable per capita emissions per year from now if we are to limit warming to 2°C?
unranked.workings: For someone born in 2017 the lifetime emissions are 122 tonnes. For a life expectancy of 85 years, the annual budget is 122/85, or ~1.4 tonnes.
